definition: to plan in advance (idiom)/a card up one's sleeve/forewarned is forearmed
chest/bosom/heart/mind/thorax
to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be
surname Cheng
to succeed/to finish/to complete/to accomplish/to become/to turn into/to be all right/OK!/one tenth
bamboo/CL:棵[ke1],支[zhi1],根[gen1]/Kangxi radical 118

sentences.english: Tom had an ace up his sleeve.
sentences.chinese: 湯姆備有錦囊妙計胸有成竹。

sentences.english: At that moment, the young man pointed to the Emperor and confidently responded, he said it.
sentences.chinese: 年輕人指指皇帝，胸有成竹地回答，是他說的。

sentences.english: XuMaoShan is in the bag says it can take cap.
sentences.chinese: 徐茂山則胸有成竹表示定能奪取山頭。

sentences.english: Shareholders expressed confidence that Buffett has the succession issue well in hand.
sentences.chinese: 股東們表示他們相信巴菲特在繼任者問題上胸有成竹。

sentences.english: The team leader has a well-thought-out plan for next year's production.
sentences.chinese: 明年的生產計劃，隊長已胸有成竹。

sentences.english: Without tests I can't answer that question with confidence.
sentences.chinese: 沒有測試，我無法胸有成竹地回答這個問題。

definition: see 胸有成竹[xiong1 you3 cheng2 zhu2]
lit. to hold the pearl of wisdom (idiom)/fig. to be endowed with extraordinary intelligence
calm/unruffled
grasp it and victory is assured/to have success within one's grasp (idiom)
calm and composed (idiom)
cool and collected (idiom); showing no sign of nerves/perfectly composed
certain/confident (of some outcome)/calm and unhurried
to know what's going on
calm/unperturbed/(Taiwanese, Tai-lo pr. [lāu-sîn-tsāi-tsāi])
not in the least concerned (idiom)/reckless/couldn't give a damn about it/unperturbed/couldn't care less/harum scarum
profound mystery
calm and unhurried (idiom); composed/to take matters calmly
to know the score (idiom)/to be well aware of the situation
calm/composed/at ease
to speak frankly with assurance
counter soldiers with arms, water with an earth weir (idiom); different situations call for different action/to adopt measures appropriate to the actual situation
